text: Yes! I found it yesterday, very useful:sparkles:

:wave:  Hi! Pablo here working in Factorial (4960096) We would like to allow our companies to book a meeting with their account manager, inside our app we have a owner_id in a company and we would like to get the meeting url of this user to display our clients the possibility to book a meeting with their account manager, we were checking `owners` and `settings/users` but we can’t have this list
We realized all the meetings have a user slug so if there is a way to get this slug from the owner_id we could solve this problem.
at the end we would like to have this data via API
I think you need Meetings API as well for this. Not quite sure though
nope this meetings are meetings that I have linked o a company or deals not the Public meetings urls linked to a user.
Try adding a print statement and pass in the event.

When creating custom code actions, before the editor there is a section where you specify the properties that you want which get passed to the event when the function gets called.

If you need properties from related objects you have to make additional API calls to get this information.

Getting the subject of an email will depend because a ticket can have multiple emails so I think you need to get the activity from a ticket and filter the response by type, etc.
Thanks a lot, I’ll try this!

Thank you for you help <@U05R380MLMC>. Using the object type id like you said it worked so then I tried adding the object type id to retrieve the objects and it worked as well so the problem has been solved. I sent request to this:

```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/p20154198_critical_events>```
What I don't get is why for critical_events objects is necessary to add the object_type_id and with sites and partners is not.
Where are the webhooks configured? This is something I haven't explored?

There’s a tab when you’re creating or managing a private app. It’s in *Settings > Account Settings > Integrations > Private Apps > [App Name] > Webhooks*. I believe you need to be a super admin on the portal to manage them?
Sweet! This opens a whole new door of possibilities

Good day I am trying to log survey entries into timeline events.
I have it working but ran into issues setting a token representing a question with MULTIPLE answers. So 2 questions here

1. If I want to send multiple answers (e.g. question is choose all that apply and choices are checkboxes with values 1-5 (so so answers could be 1 or 1,3 or 1,2,4)). Would I set this up in the template as an enumeration (this leads me to believe that I would <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/properties/property-field-types-in-HubSpot> and I have
2. when sending data how would I format the array? I have tried "1,2,3" [1,2,3] ["1","2","3"] using semi colon vs comma nothing works, except sending 1 answer at a time
Is this the correct place to ask questions about webhooks? I'm trying to figure out how to make HubSpot send a post to a webhook on a hubDB event like publish or update.

Hey, I'm attempting to GET data from "<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/content-audit|CMS Content Audit"> API (`/cms/v3/audit-logs/`) and i'm noticing two things (:ladybug:?)
1. `after` param only works with Unix timestamp (not ISO as other endpoints work with)
2. `eventType` param throws error when passing any or all documented values (CREATED,UPDATED,PUBLISHED,DELETED,UNPUBLISHED)
Could you guys let me know if 1. is expected as unix, and 2. is working? Thanks!!
